member.param: Value between 0 and 1 indicating the weight of .
When the method completes, contains the linear interpolation of the two colors.
member.remarks: This method performs the linear interpolation based on the following formula. start + (end - start) * amount Passing a value of 0 will cause to be returned; a value of 1 will cause to be returned.

member.remarks: Regarding the Helix Toolkit: Based on http://www.flipcode.com/archives/Efficient_Polygon_Triangulation.shtml References http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Polygon_triangulation http://computacion.cs.cinvestav.mx/~anzures/geom/triangulation.php http://www.codeproject.com/KB/recipes/cspolygontriangulation.aspx

member.name: M:SeeingSharp.AngleSingle.#ctor(System.Single,System.Single)
member.summary: Initializes a new instance of the SeeingSharp.AngleSingle structure using the arc length formula ( = s/r).

member.name: M:SeeingSharp.AngleSingle.Wrap
member.summary: Wraps this SeeingSharp.AngleSingle to be in the range [, -].

member.name: M:SeeingSharp.AngleSingle.WrapPositive
member.summary: Wraps this SeeingSharp.AngleSingle to be in the range [0, 2).

member.name: P:SeeingSharp.AngleSingle.Revolutions
member.summary: Gets or sets the total number of revolutions this SeeingSharp.AngleSingle represents.

member.name: P:SeeingSharp.AngleSingle.Degrees
member.summary: Gets or sets the total number of degrees this SeeingSharp.AngleSingle represents.

member.name: P:SeeingSharp.AngleSingle.Minutes
member.summary: Gets or sets the minutes component of the degrees this SeeingSharp.AngleSingle represents. When setting the minutes, if the value is in the range (-60, 60) the whole degrees are not changed; otherwise, the whole degrees may be changed. Fractional values may set the seconds component.

member.name: P:SeeingSharp.AngleSingle.Seconds
member.summary: Gets or sets the seconds of the degrees this SeeingSharp.AngleSingle represents. When setting te seconds, if the value is in the range (-60, 60) the whole minutes or whole degrees are not changed; otherwise, the whole minutes or whole degrees may be changed.

member.name: P:SeeingSharp.AngleSingle.Radians
member.summary: Gets or sets the total number of radians this SeeingSharp.AngleSingle represents.

member.name: P:SeeingSharp.AngleSingle.Milliradians
member.summary: Gets or sets the total number of milliradians this SeeingSharp.AngleSingle represents. One milliradian is equal to 1/(2000).

member.name: P:SeeingSharp.AngleSingle.Gradians
member.summary: Gets or sets the total number of gradians this SeeingSharp.AngleSingle represents.

member.name: P:SeeingSharp.AngleSingle.IsRight
member.summary: Gets a System.Boolean that determines whether this SeeingSharp.Angle is a right angle (i.e. 90 or /2).

member.name: P:SeeingSharp.AngleSingle.IsStraight
member.summary: Gets a System.Boolean that determines whether this SeeingSharp.Angle is a straight angle (i.e. 180 or ).

member.name: P:SeeingSharp.AngleSingle.IsFullRotation
member.summary: Gets a System.Boolean that determines whether this SeeingSharp.Angle is a full rotation angle (i.e. 360 or 2).

member.name: P:SeeingSharp.AngleSingle.IsOblique
member.summary: Gets a System.Boolean that determines whether this SeeingSharp.Angle is an oblique angle (i.e. is not 90 or a multiple of 90).

member.name: P:SeeingSharp.AngleSingle.IsAcute
member.summary: Gets a System.Boolean that determines whether this SeeingSharp.Angle is an acute angle (i.e. less than 90 but greater than 0).

member.name: P:SeeingSharp.AngleSingle.IsObtuse
member.summary: Gets a System.Boolean that determines whether this SeeingSharp.Angle is an obtuse angle (i.e. greater than 90 but less than 180).

member.name: P:SeeingSharp.AngleSingle.IsReflex
member.summary: Gets a System.Boolean that determines whether this SeeingSharp.Angle is a reflex angle (i.e. greater than 180 but less than 360).

member.name: P:SeeingSharp.AngleSingle.Complement
member.summary: Gets a SeeingSharp.AngleSingle instance that complements this angle (i.e. the two angles add to 90).

member.name: P:SeeingSharp.AngleSingle.Supplement
member.summary: Gets a SeeingSharp.AngleSingle instance that supplements this angle (i.e. the two angles add to 180).

member.name: M:SeeingSharp.BoundingFrustum.GetZoomToExtentsShiftDistance(System.Numerics.Vector3[])

member.name: M:SeeingSharp.Collision.RayIntersectsPoint(SeeingSharp.Ray@,System.Numerics.Vector3@)
member.summary: Determines whether there is an intersection between a and a point.

member.name: M:SeeingSharp.Collision.RayIntersectsRay(SeeingSharp.Ray@,SeeingSharp.Ray@,System.Numerics.Vector3@)
member.summary: Determines whether there is an intersection between a and a .
member.param: When the method completes, contains the point of intersection, or if there was no intersection.
member.remarks: This method performs a ray vs ray intersection test based on the following formula from Goldman. s = det([o_2 - o_1, d_2, d_1 x d_2]) / ||d_1 x d_2||^2 t = det([o_2 - o_1, d_1, d_1 x d_2]) / ||d_1 x d_2||^2 Where o_1 is the position of the first ray, o_2 is the position of the second ray, d_1 is the normalized direction of the first ray, d_2 is the normalized direction of the second ray, det denotes the determinant of a matrix, x denotes the cross product, [ ] denotes a matrix, and || || denotes the length or magnitude of a vector.

member.name: M:SeeingSharp.Collision.RayIntersectsPlane(SeeingSharp.Ray@,SeeingSharp.Plane@,System.Single@)
member.summary: Determines whether there is an intersection between a and a .
member.param: When the method completes, contains the distance of the intersection, or 0 if there was no intersection.

member.name: M:SeeingSharp.Collision.RayIntersectsPlane(SeeingSharp.Ray@,SeeingSharp.Plane@,System.Numerics.Vector3@)
member.summary: Determines whether there is an intersection between a and a .
member.param: When the method completes, contains the point of intersection, or if there was no intersection.

member.name: M:SeeingSharp.Collision.RayIntersectsTriangle(SeeingSharp.Ray@,System.Numerics.Vector3@,System.Numerics.Vector3@,System.Numerics.Vector3@,System.Single@)
member.summary: Determines whether there is an intersection between a and a triangle.
member.param: The first vertex of the triangle to test.
The second vertex of the triagnle to test.
The third vertex of the triangle to test.
When the method completes, contains the distance of the intersection, or 0 if there was no intersection.
member.remarks: This method tests if the ray intersects either the front or back of the triangle. If the ray is parallel to the triangle's plane, no intersection is assumed to have happened. If the intersection of the ray and the triangle is behind the origin of the ray, no intersection is assumed to have happened. In both cases of assumptions, this method returns false.

member.name: M:SeeingSharp.Collision.RayIntersectsTriangle(SeeingSharp.Ray@,System.Numerics.Vector3@,System.Numerics.Vector3@,System.Numerics.Vector3@,System.Numerics.Vector3@)

member.name: M:SeeingSharp.Collision.PlaneIntersectsPlane(SeeingSharp.Plane@,SeeingSharp.Plane@,SeeingSharp.Ray@)
member.summary: Determines whether there is an intersection between a and a .

member.remarks: Although a ray is set to have an origin, the ray returned by this method is really a line in three dimensions which has no real origin. The ray is considered valid when both the positive direction is used and when the negative direction is used.

member.name: T:SeeingSharp.OrientedBoundingBox
member.summary: OrientedBoundingBox (OBB) is a rectangular block, much like an AABB (BoundingBox) but with an arbitrary orientation.

member.summary: Half lengths of the box along eaxh axis.

member.name: F:SeeingSharp.OrientedBoundingBox.Transformation
member.summary: The matrix which aligns and scales the box, and its tarnslation vector represents the center of the box.

member.name: M:SeeingSharp.OrientedBoundingBox.#ctor(SeeingSharp.BoundingBox)
member.summary: Creates an from a BoundingBox.
member.remarks: Initially, the OBB is axis-aligned box, but it can be rotated and transformed later.

member.name: M:SeeingSharp.OrientedBoundingBox.#ctor(System.Numerics.Vector3,System.Numerics.Vector3)
member.summary: Creates an which contained between two minimum and maximum points.
member.param: The minimum vertex of the bounding box.
The maximum vertex of the bounding box.
member.remarks: Initially, the OrientedBoundingBox is axis-aligned box, but it can be rotated and transformed later.

member.name: M:SeeingSharp.OrientedBoundingBox.#ctor(System.Numerics.Vector3[])
member.summary: Creates an that fully contains the given points.
member.param: The points that will be contained by the box.
member.remarks: This method is not for computing the best tight-fitting OrientedBoundingBox. And initially, the OrientedBoundingBox is axis-aligned box, but it can be rotated and transformed later.

member.name: M:SeeingSharp.OrientedBoundingBox.GetCorners
member.summary: Retrieves the eight corners of the bounding box.
member.returns: An array of points representing the eight corners of the bounding box.

member.name: M:SeeingSharp.OrientedBoundingBox.Transform(System.Numerics.Matrix4x4@)
member.summary: Transforms this box using a transformation matrix.
member.remarks: While any kind of transformation can be applied, it is recommended to apply scaling using scale method instead, which scales the Extents and keeps the Transformation matrix for rotation only, and that preserves collision detection accuracy.

member.name: M:SeeingSharp.OrientedBoundingBox.Transform(System.Numerics.Matrix4x4)
member.summary: Transforms this box using a transformation matrix.

member.name: M:SeeingSharp.OrientedBoundingBox.Scale(System.Numerics.Vector3@)
member.summary: Scales the by scaling its Extents without affecting the Transformation matrix, By keeping Transformation matrix scaling-free, the collision detection methods will be more accurate.

member.summary: Scales the by scaling its Extents without affecting the Transformation matrix, By keeping Transformation matrix scaling-free, the collision detection methods will be more accurate.
